text: Drew LeBlanc (born June 29, 1989, in Duluth, Minnesota) is an American professional ice hockey center that currently plays for the Iserlohn Roosters of the Deutsche Eishockey Liga (DEL). He also played for the Chicago Blackhawks of the National Hockey League (NHL) and Augsburger Panther. He was not drafted by a team but he signed a 1-year contract with the Blackhawks on April 12, 2013. He played college hockey at St. Cloud State University and won the Hobey Baker Award as the top National Collegiate Athletic Association (NCAA) men's ice hockey player in 2013. On July 10, 2015, headed to Germany and signed a one-year contract with Augsburger Panther of the Deutsche Eishockey Liga (DEL). He would later extend his contract with them in March 2017. On July 7, 2023, LeBlanc became a free agent and signed a one-year contract with Iserlohn Roosters. ==References== ==Other websites== * Category:1989 births Category:American ice hockey centers Category:Chicago Blackhawks players Category:Living people Category:People from Duluth, Minnesota Category:Rockford IceHogs (AHL) players Category:Sportspeople from Minnesota Category:United States Hockey League players
title: Drew LeBlanc
